newsitem.title: THAILAND: Honda says had record 1996 Thai sales.
newsitem.headline: Honda says had record 1996 Thai sales.

text.p: Asian Honda Motor Co Ltd, Honda's Thailand-based regional headquarters, said on Tuesday it had record 1996 sales and increased market shares for all three of its product lines in Thailand.
Honda said in a statement its total vehicle sales soared 44 percent to a record 42,421 units in 1996. It said the company targets an 11 percent increase in sales in 1997 to 47,000 units.

"With the total Thai passenger car market growing at only 4.6 percent last year, Honda's strong sales performance saw its market share climb from 17.9 percent in 1995 to 23.4 percent in 1996," the statement said.
Honda said its main car models dominated each of the three market segments in which they are present.
Honda increased its motorcycle sales to 640,545 units, or 52 percent of the market share, the company said.
The company said its power product sales increased by seven percent to a record 175,967 units.
Thailand is Honda's largest manufacturing base in Asia outside Japan.
